levels.level 1: Bluetooth is a wireless technology standard used for exchanging data between fixed and mobile devices over short distances using short-wavelength UHF radio waves in the industrial, scientific and medical radio bands, from 2.402 GHz to 2.480 GHz, and building personal area networks (PANs). It was originally conceived as a wireless alternative to RS-232 data cables.Bluetooth is managed by the Bluetooth Special Interest Group (SIG). A manufacturer must meet Bluetooth SIG standards to market it as a Bluetooth device.

A manufacturer must meet Bluetooth SIG standards to market it as a Bluetooth device.
